word_forms.definition_en: good or special and thus worth remembering; unforgettable

examples.example: The amazing white sand beaches, friendly people, and delicious food made our trip to Thailand truly memorable.
examples.translate: 令人驚嘆的白色沙灘、友善的人們，以及美味的食物讓我們的泰國之旅實在難忘。

examples.example: Nancy is good at memorizing texts within a very short period of time, but she usually forgets them after a few days.
examples.translate: Nancy很擅長在很短的時間內記住課文，但通常幾天後她就把它們忘了。

examples.example: Laney’s visit to her grandparents’ home in Chiayi brought back childhood memories.
examples.translate: Laney造訪嘉義祖父母家，喚起了她的童年回憶。

examples.example: Fiona has a really good memory. She can remember most of her best friends’ phone numbers.
examples.translate: Fiona記憶力很好。她能記得她大多數最好朋友的電話號碼。

examples.example: The seven-year-old kid could tell the whole story from memory without looking at the page even once.
examples.translate: 這個七歲大的孩子可以憑記憶說出整個故事，連一頁書都不需要看一眼。

word_forms.definition_en: something that is said, written, or done as an answer

examples.example: The question was really hard, so Dylan thought for several seconds before he made a reply to the teacher.
examples.translate: 這個問題真的非常難，所以Dylan回答老師之前，想了好幾秒鐘。

examples.example: In reply to your question about my health, I am feeling much better now.
examples.translate: 回覆你關於我健康的問題，我現在覺得好多了。

examples.example: Brad has the habit of replying to every email right after he reads it.
examples.translate: Brad習慣在讀了每封電子郵件後就馬上回信。

examples.example: The singer replied that he had nothing to say about his family problems.
examples.translate: 關於他的家庭問題，這位歌手回答他無可奉告。

word_forms.definition_en: to shout loudly or angrily

examples.example: One neighbor called the police because George was yelling at his family in the middle of the night.
examples.translate: 一位鄰居報了警，因為George在半夜對他的家人大叫。

word_forms.definition_en: with no mistakes or problems

examples.example: John was very careful with his car, so it was still in perfect condition after five years of use.
examples.translate: John對於他的車子十分小心，所以使用五年之後車子依然保持完美狀態。

word_forms.definition_en: by chance or by mistake

examples.example: Sheila accidentally spilled coffee on her new dress, and it left a mark.
examples.translate: Sheila不小心把咖啡潑在她的新洋裝上，留了個印子。

examples.example: The horrible car accident took the lives of several children.
examples.translate: 這個可怕的車禍奪去了幾名孩童的性命。

examples.example: An accidental wrong turn led us to a beautiful, undiscovered beach.
examples.translate: 一個意外的轉錯彎，帶領我們到了一個美麗、未被發現的海灘。

word_forms.definition_en: the fact that someone or something does not achieve success

examples.example: The meeting was a total failure since nothing was decided at all.
examples.translate: 這會議徹底失敗，因為什麼也沒有決定。

examples.example: Because of the terrible weather, the team’s plan to have a picnic ended in failure.
examples.translate: 因為那糟糕的天氣，小組想要野餐的計畫以失敗告終。

word_forms.definition_en: to remember

examples.example: Yvonne’s grandmother recalled that she married the most handsome man in town at twenty.
examples.translate: Yvonne的祖母回想起她二十歲時嫁給了鎮上最帥的男人。

word_forms.definition_en: a meeting where something is shown to a group of people by one or multiple speakers

examples.example: Each student must give a presentation on one movie at the end of the semester.
examples.translate: 每位學生必須在學期末就一部電影作報告。

examples.example: Hannah is going to present her report to her professor tomorrow.
examples.translate: 明日Hannah將提交她的報告給教授。

examples.example: Michelle presented her best friend with flowers at her birthday party.
examples.translate: Michelle在最好朋友的生日派對上送了花給她。

word_forms.definition_zh: 故意不參加；不做（該做的事）
word_forms.definition_en: to not do something that you normally do or are expected to do

examples.example: I don’t usually skip class because I don’t like to fall behind my classmates.
examples.translate: 我通常不缺課，因為我不喜歡落後我的同學。

examples.example: James was running out of time, so he skipped the last part of his talk.
examples.translate: James快要沒有時間了，所以他略過他報告的最後一部分。

examples.example: Paul skipped to the second page of the magazine because the first page wasn’t very interesting.
examples.translate: Paul跳到那本雜誌的第二頁，因為第一頁並不怎麼有趣。

word_forms.definition_en: to spoil or destroy something entirely

examples.example: Mandy’s sandcastle was suddenly ruined when a big wave splashed onto it.
examples.translate: Mandy的沙堡突然被一個大浪拍打到而毀壞。

examples.example: Many temples, churches, and libraries in China fell into ruin during the period between 1966 and 1976.
examples.translate: 很多中國的寺廟、教堂以及圖書館在1966年至1976年間變成了廢墟。

word_forms.definition_en: feeling ashamed or uncomfortable in public because of something that has happened or been said

examples.example: Amy was really embarrassed about her mistake during the dance class, though nobody noticed it.
examples.translate: 雖然沒有人注意到，Amy對於她在舞蹈課時所犯的錯誤，感到非常尷尬。

word_forms.definition_zh: 令人尷尬的；令人難堪的

examples.example: Tina experienced an embarrassing situation when she fell asleep during the yoga class and the teacher had to wake her up.
examples.translate: Tina經歷過一個尷尬的狀況，她在瑜珈課睡著，而老師必須喚醒她。

examples.example: Did I embarrass you when I told our friends that you and your classmate Ken used to be dating?
examples.translate: 當我告訴我們的朋友們，你以前常和你的同學Ken約會，會讓你感到尷尬嗎？

examples.example: To Dave’s embarrassment, he found that he was wearing his T-shirt inside out.
examples.translate: 令Dave感到尷尬的是，他發現他把他的T恤裡外穿反了。

word_forms.definition_en: feeling extremely sad

examples.example: Emilia felt deeply depressed after her smartphone was stolen.
examples.translate: Emilia在她的智慧型手機被偷後，感到非常沮喪。

examples.example: The sudden death of her pet goldfish really depressed Cindy and her brother Tim.
examples.translate: Cindy的寵物金魚突然死掉，實在使她和她的弟弟Tim感到沮喪。

examples.example: After a long period of deep depression, Amanda finally found happiness again.
examples.translate: Amanda極度沮喪很長一段時間後，終於再次找到快樂。

word_forms.definition_en: to make someone unhappy or disappointed

examples.example: You shouldn’t speak to your parents in an impolite way since you could upset them.
examples.translate: 你不應該用不禮貌的方式跟你的父母親說話，因為你可能會使他們難過。

examples.example: Kyle was deeply upset about not winning first place in the swimming race.
examples.translate: Kyle對於沒有贏得游泳比賽第一名，感到非常難過。

word_forms.definition_en: to think carefully about something that has happened

examples.example: Barbara spent a whole week reflecting on her college choice.
examples.translate: Barbara花了一整個星期認真思考要上哪一間大學。

examples.example: The lake was calm and reflected Tom’s face when he looked down at the water.
examples.translate: 這座湖很平靜，當Tom往下望著湖水時，湖面映出他的臉。

examples.example: The funny little dog started barking wildly at its own reflection in the mirror.
examples.translate: 這隻好笑的小狗開始對著鏡子裡自己的影像瘋狂地吠叫。

word_forms.definition_en: to make someone remember to do something or to make someone remember something or someone

examples.example: Ms. Chen reminded her students of the importance of checking their homework.
examples.translate: 陳老師提醒她的學生們檢查他們作業的重要性。

word_forms.definition_en: to clearly understand something

examples.example: Matt suddenly realized that the time on his watch was wrong and that he was late for the meeting.
examples.translate: Matt突然了解到，他手錶上的時間是錯的，而且他開會遲到了。

examples.example: The young woman finally realized her dream of visiting every country in the world by herself.
examples.translate: 這位年輕的女士最終實現了她獨自造訪世上每個國家的夢想。

word_forms.definition_en: following or belonging to the long-held customs and ways of life of a group of people, unchanged for many years

examples.example: Bella lived in Mexico for several years and can cook several traditional Mexican dishes.
examples.translate: Bella在墨西哥住了幾年，會煮幾道傳統墨西哥菜餚。

examples.example: The tradition of giving red envelopes to children on Lunar New Year’s Eve started thousands of years ago in China.
examples.translate: 在除夕夜給孩童紅包的傳統始於幾千年前的中國。

examples.example: By American tradition, a bride should not be seen by the groom in her wedding dress before the wedding.
examples.translate: 根據美國的傳統，在婚禮前新娘不應該被新郎看到她穿結婚禮服的樣子。

word_forms.definition_en: luckily

examples.example: Fortunately, few people were hurt when the building fell down during the earthquake.
examples.translate: 幸運地，地震期間這棟大樓倒塌的時候，幾乎沒有人受傷。

examples.example: We are fortunate to have clean drinking water in most homes in our country.
examples.translate: 我們很幸運，我們的國家裡大部分的家中都有乾淨的飲用水。

word_forms.definition_en: the remaining part of something or the others in a group

examples.example: Daryl took a few bites of the cake and then gave the rest of it to his little sister.
examples.translate: Daryl吃了幾口蛋糕，然後把剩下的蛋糕給他的小妹妹。

word_forms.definition_en: being physically present somewhere

examples.example: Deborah decided to visit the museum in person to see the paintings instead of looking at them online.
examples.translate: Deborah決定親自去博物館看那些畫作，而不是在網上看它們。

word_forms.definition_en: to consider someone or something to be important and worthy of attention

examples.example: Archie loves making fun of people, so don’t take his words seriously.
examples.translate: Archie喜愛嘲笑人，所以不要把他的話當真。

word_forms.definition_en: to fail to meet someone’s expectations or keep a promise that you made

examples.example: Roy promised his daughter that he would attend her school play, and he didn’t let her down.
examples.translate: Roy答應他女兒會出席她的學校話劇表演，而且他沒有讓她失望。

word_forms.definition_en: to check something and be certain about it

examples.example: Please make sure that you don’t go over the speed limit when you are driving.
examples.translate: 請確保當你開車時不會超速。

word_forms.definition_en: to regard someone or something as the most important thing

examples.example: Most parents put their children’s needs first and want them to be happy and healthy.
examples.translate: 大多數的父母認為其子女的需求最重要，並希望他們可以開心健康。

word_forms.definition_en: to wear a special costume or special clothes, usually for a special occasion

examples.example: Every Halloween, the young cousins dress up as their favorite cartoon characters.
examples.translate: 每年的萬聖夜，年幼的堂表弟妹們都會裝扮成他們最喜愛的卡通角色。

word_forms.definition_zh: 一個線上遊戲化互動學習平臺
一個透過單字卡等方式學習的應用程式
辛奇（南韓文化體育觀光部對於韓式泡菜的華語標準譯名）
